summary: This is an FBI Miami Division internal request form to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) to scan and process telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The records, from an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein, are believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims and Epstein's associates. The document outlines the procedural steps for digitizing and loading the data into the FBI's Telephone Application (TA) repository.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein; subject of obstruction of justice case
persons.context: He is the subject of the FBI's obstruction of justice investigation for attempting to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein, rather than turning it over to law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: He is identified as the employer of Alfredo Rodriguez and the central figure in a child prostitution case. An address book from his possession is the subject of the evidence being processed.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Epstein.
Rodriguez possessed an address book believed to contain information on Epstein's underage victims and attempted to sell it, obstructing the investigation into Epstein.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: The Miami Division of the FBI opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Request to process Epstein address book records
events.description: The FBI Miami Division formally requested the Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and process telephone records from an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein that was in Alfredo Rodriguez's possession.

locations: Winchester, Virginia 22602 (Location of the FBI Document Conversion Laboratory)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, was under FBI investigation for obstruction of justice for attempting to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.
The address book in question was believed to contain contact information for previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
The FBI was processing telephone records from the address book (target number 340-690-1012) for incorporation into its centralized Telephone Application (TA) intelligence repository.
The document is a procedural request form detailing the FBI's internal process for digitizing and analyzing hard-copy evidence in support of an ongoing investigation.
